intro: Pectis masonii, commonly known as Mason's pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Pectis masonii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
